page.title: 03LANDSCAPE
page.content: MOST OF THE STUDY BLOCK IS LESS THAN 46METRES ABOVE SEA LEVEL.THE BLOCK IS DOMINATED BY GENTLE SLOPES EXCEPT FOR WHERE THE "DEAD"CLIFFLINE TURNS PARALLEL TO THE SHORE AND ALSO ALONG THE LOWER REACHES OF THE GOLLACHY,BUCKIE,AND RATHVEN BURNS.WHICHHAVE GORGE FEATURES.THE FREUCHING BURN ALSO HAD A DEEP STEEP SIDED STRETCH OF VALLEY BUT THIS HAS RECENTLY BEEN FILLED BY THE LOCAL AUTHORITY AND THE NEW SURFACE LAID OUT AS GRASS AND PATHS.THE SHORELINE HAS BEEN MUCH MODIFIED BY MAN AS A RESULT OF HARBOUR DEVELOPMENT AND COASTAL PROTECTION WORKS.THERE ARE SMALL SECTIONS OF SHINGLE BEACH BUT THE SHORELINE IS MAINLY ROCKY WITH A FINE WAVE CUT PLATFORM.EVIDENT AT LOW TIDE BETWEEN BUCKPOOL AND PORTGORDON.
